titles.title: A resolution to express the sense of the Senate that it is in the best interests of United States wheat producers to immediately receive the details of the 1988 wheat program and that the program should include no more than a 27 1/2 percent acreage limitation level.

vote.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 6/19/1987--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) it is in the best interests of U.S. wheat producers to immediately receive the details of the program for the 1988 crop of wheat established under the Agricultural Act of 1949; and (2) such program should provide for an acreage limitation program under which a farm's wheat acreage would be limited to the wheat crop acreage base for the farm reduced by no more than 27 1/2 percent.
